lines.content: * The main user interface for the "ChatBot", promptly named BobBot.
* This class is a front to manage user input, displaying the corresponding output,
* and managed the conditional statements for the prompting.
public static void main(String[] args) throws DukeException {
System.out.println("Nicely done! I've marked this task as done: ");
System.out.println("Hey, stop that! Please enter a number for the Task ID.");

System.out.println("Alright-o, I have deleted the following task:");

System.out.println("Please put your deadline's date in this format: yyyy-mm-dd hhmm");

System.out.println("Fun! I've added this event for you: ");
System.out.println("You now have " + ts.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Please put your event's date in this format: yyyy-mm-dd hhmm");

* Represents a generic exception for our Duke bot.
* This class acts as a base for all specific Exception types.
* It can be extended to create the corresponding Exception.
public abstract class DukeException extends Exception {
* Will call the super constructor from the Java Exception object.
* @param message The error message of the Exception.
* Represents a Invalid Command Exception for our Duke bot.
* This exception should be thrown when we are unable to recognise our user's input, such as an unknown command etc.
* Will call the super constructor from the DukeException object.
* @param m The error message of the Exception.
* Returns a string representation of this DukeExceptionInvalidCommand.
* Includes a mini-help guide to tell the user the available commands.
return "Hey! I don't know that command yet, I only recognize the following commands: \n" +
"2. mark <ID number of task in list> \n" +
"3. unmark <ID number of task in list> \n" +
"4. delete <ID number of task in list> \n" +
"6. event <event name> /from <event from date> /to <event to date> \n" +
* Represents a Invalid Numbering Exception for our Duke bot.
* This exception should be thrown specifically for the commands: mark, unmark and delete.
* It occurs when the number provided does not exist in storage, or if the storage is empty.
* Will call the super constructor from the DukeException object.
* @param m The error message of the Exception.
* @param id The attempted ID number provided for the object.
* Returns a string representation of this DukeExceptionInvalidNumbering.
return "Check the list! The task id of " + this.id + " you are referring doesn't exist!" + super.toString();
return "The list is empty! You have yet to enter any task!" + super.toString();
* Represents a Invalid Parameters Exception for our Duke bot.
* This exception should be thrown specifically for the commands: todo, events and deadlines.
* It occurs when the parameters provided do not fit the requirement of the command.
* Will call the super constructor from the DukeException object.
* @param m The error message of the Exception.
* Returns a string representation of this DukeExceptionInvalidParameters.
* Includes a mini-help guide to tell the user the parameters.
return "Wait a second, your command has invalid parameters! \n" +
"Please follow the following format for the commands: \n" +
"2. mark <ID number of task in list> \n" +
"3. unmark <ID number of task in list> \n" +
"4. delete <ID number of task in list> \n" +
"6. event <event name> /from <event from date> /to <event to date> \n" +

* Represents a FileReader object for Duke bot.
* Handles reading of text data from files within the /resources directory, at data.txt.
* Class is created to abstract the details of file output operations.
* Reads the file line-by-line to create an ArrayList of Task and TaskStorage object.
* Uses the convertDataFile to help convert each String line to it's corresponding Task.
* @return A TaskStorage object with the saved tasks in it.
System.out.println("Saved data corrupted, will begin anew");
System.out.println("Saved data corrupted, will begin anew");
* Takes in an ArrayList of Strings, and converts each string to a Task.
* Saves the tasks into a ArrayList that will be used to create a TaskStorage object in the future.
* @return An ArrayList of Tasks that were saved in the data.txt file.
* Represents a FileWriter object for Duke bot.
* Handles writing of created Tasks information to the /resources directory, at data.txt.
* Class is created to abstract the details of file input operations.
* Writes into the /resources/data.txt file line-by-line to save the created Tasks.
* Note that it will override the text file, thus ensuring that it's updated to the latest copy.
* @return A boolean value on whether the writing is successful or not.
